subject: Re: [junit] Philosophic: Stress Testing with jUnit
msgSnippet: ... JUnit does not easily meet the requirements of system testing, in general, so that forces my answer to be No . JUnit was designed to test classes and
messageBody:
> Does jUnit meet requirements of stress testing?

JUnit does not easily meet the requirements of system testing, in general, so
that forces my answer to be "No".

JUnit was designed to test classes and small sets of components. It *may* be
used for other kinds of testing, but that wasn't how it evolved.

That said, I have done class-level stress testing and performance testing
with JUnit before. It has been effective to varying degrees.

--
J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
